summaryDescription: Hector Guimard (1867-1942)  was a leading exponent of the French Art Nouveau style.  Strongly influenced by Victor Horta, his work is characterised by flowing scrolls and fluid acqueous and vegetal ornament.  His best known works a re the Castel Beranger, 1894-8 and the entrances to the Paris Metros, 1900.  He also designed furniture and interior fittings.
physicalDescription: Rectangular balcony front, the fluid upright sections are decorated with curling vegetal scrolls. Interlocking these are curling tendrils of abstracted floral and vegetal motifs.
objectHistory: Historical significance: Guimard was a leading exponent of the French Art Nouveau style.  Strongly influenced by Victor Horta, his work is characterised by flowing scrolls and fluid acqueous and vegetal ornament.  His best known works a re the Castel Beranger, 1894-8 and the entrances to the Paris Metros, 1900.  He also designed furniture and interior fittings.
briefDescription: Cast iron balcony front designed by Hector Guimard, France ca. 1900.
bibliographicReferences/0/free: Campbell, Marian <font -u>An Introduction to Ironwork</font>, London, HMSO, 1985. p.35 ill.  ISBN 0112904157
galleryLabels/0/text:
BALCONY PANEL

Guimard's best known works in iron are the entrances to the Paris Métro, first commissioned in 1900.  A fireplace is displayed in the Ironwork Gallery (Room 114C).
